trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Salesforce Sandbox | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Salesforce Sandbox | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Salesforce Sandbox with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Salesforce Sandbox with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Salesforce Sandbox
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Salesforce Sandbox

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Salesforce Sandbox.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Salesforce Sandbox.

trans-unit.source: Sandboxes give you the ability to create multiple copies of your organization in separate environments for a variety of purposes, such as development, testing, and training, without compromising the data and applications in your Salesforce production organization.
trans-unit.target: Sandboxes give you the ability to create multiple copies of your organization in separate environments for a variety of purposes, such as development, testing, and training, without compromising the data and applications in your Salesforce production organization.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <link><linkText>Sandbox Overview</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <link><linkText>Sandbox Overview</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A sandbox in Salesforce.com
trans-unit.target: A sandbox in Salesforce.com

trans-unit.source: If you don’t have a valid sandbox in Salesforce.com yet, you need to contact Salesforce.
trans-unit.target: If you don’t have a valid sandbox in Salesforce.com yet, you need to contact Salesforce.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Salesforce Sandbox
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Salesforce Sandbox

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Enabling your domain
trans-unit.target: Enabling your domain

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Salesforce Sandbox
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Salesforce Sandbox

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Salesforce sandbox.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Salesforce sandbox.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Salesforce sandbox, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Salesforce sandbox, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To open the Application Gallery, click Add An App, and then click Add an application for my organization to use.
trans-unit.target: To open the Application Gallery, click Add An App, and then click Add an application for my organization to use.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>What do you want to do?</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>What do you want to do?</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Salesforce Sandbox.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Salesforce Sandbox.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Salesforce Sandbox, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Salesforce Sandbox, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Salesforce Sandbox</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Salesforce Sandbox</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Salesforce with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Salesforce with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Salesforce Sandbox application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Salesforce Sandbox application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Salesforce Sandbox page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Salesforce Sandbox page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Salesforce Sandbox</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Salesforce Sandbox</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Salesforce Sandbox Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.my.salesforce.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Salesforce Sandbox Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.my.salesforce.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Salesforce Sandbox page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Salesforce Sandbox page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Salesforce sandbox as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Salesforce sandbox as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Setup.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Setup.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane on the left, click Security Controls, and then click Single Sign-On Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the navigation pane on the left, click Security Controls, and then click Single Sign-On Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Single Sign-On Settings section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Single Sign-On Settings section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select SAML Enabled.
trans-unit.target: Select SAML Enabled.

trans-unit.source: Click New.
trans-unit.target: Click New.

trans-unit.source: On the SAML Single Sign-On Settings section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the SAML Single Sign-On Settings section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Name textbox, type the name of the configuration (e.g.: SPSSOWAAD\_Test).
trans-unit.target: In the Name textbox, type the name of the configuration (e.g.: SPSSOWAAD\_Test).

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Salesforce Sandbox dialogue page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Salesforce Sandbox dialogue page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Entity id textbox, type https://test.salesforce.com.
trans-unit.target: In the Entity id textbox, type https://test.salesforce.com.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse to upload the downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse to upload the downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: As SAML Identity Type, select Assertion contains the Federation ID from the User object.
trans-unit.target: As SAML Identity Type, select Assertion contains the Federation ID from the User object.

trans-unit.source: As SAML Identity Location, select Identity is in the NameIdentifier element of the Subject statement.
trans-unit.target: As SAML Identity Location, select Identity is in the NameIdentifier element of the Subject statement.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Salesforce Sandbox dialogue page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Salesforce Sandbox dialogue page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Salesforce Sandbox dialogue page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Salesforce Sandbox dialogue page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: As Service Provider Initiated Request Binding, select HTTP POST.
trans-unit.target: As Service Provider Initiated Request Binding, select HTTP POST.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling your domain
trans-unit.target: Enabling your domain

trans-unit.source: This section assumes that you already have created a domain.
trans-unit.target: This section assumes that you already have created a domain.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <link><linkText>Defining Your Domain Name</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <link><linkText>Defining Your Domain Name</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To enable your domain, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable your domain, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, click Domain Management, and then click My Domain.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, click Domain Management, and then click My Domain.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Please make sure that your domain has been configured correctly.
trans-unit.target: Please make sure that your domain has been configured correctly.

trans-unit.source: In the Login Page Settings section, click Edit, then, as Authentication Service, select the name of the SAML Single Sign-On Setting from the previous section, and finally click Save.
trans-unit.target: In the Login Page Settings section, click Edit, then, as Authentication Service, select the name of the SAML Single Sign-On Setting from the previous section, and finally click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As soon as you have a domain configured, your users should use the domain URL to login to the Salesforce sandbox.
trans-unit.target: As soon as you have a domain configured, your users should use the domain URL to login to the Salesforce sandbox.

trans-unit.source: To get the value of the URL, click the SSO profile you have created in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: To get the value of the URL, click the SSO profile you have created in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable user provisioning of Active Directory user accounts to Salesforce Sandbox.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable user provisioning of Active Directory user accounts to Salesforce Sandbox.

trans-unit.source: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Salesforce portal, in the top navigation bar, select your name to expand your user menu:
trans-unit.target: In the Salesforce portal, in the top navigation bar, select your name to expand your user menu:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>My Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>My Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From your user menu, select My Settings to open your My Settings page.
trans-unit.target: From your user menu, select My Settings to open your My Settings page.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, click Personal to expand the Personal section, and then click Reset My Security Token:
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, click Personal to expand the Personal section, and then click Reset My Security Token:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>My Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>My Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Reset My Security Token page, click Reset Security Token to request an email that contains your Salesforce.com security token.
trans-unit.target: On the Reset My Security Token page, click Reset Security Token to request an email that contains your Salesforce.com security token.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Token</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Token</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Check your email inbox for an email from Salesforce.com with “salesforce.com.com security confirmation” as subject.
trans-unit.target: Check your email inbox for an email from Salesforce.com with “salesforce.com.com security confirmation” as subject.

trans-unit.source: Review this email and copy the security token value.
trans-unit.target: Review this email and copy the security token value.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the salesforce Sandbox application integration page, click Configure user provisioning to open the Configure User Provisioning dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the salesforce Sandbox application integration page, click Configure user provisioning to open the Configure User Provisioning dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure user provisioning</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure user provisioning</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Enter your Salesforce Sandbox credentials to enable automatic user provisioning page, provide the following configuration settings:
trans-unit.target: On the Enter your Salesforce Sandbox credentials to enable automatic user provisioning page, provide the following configuration settings:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Salesforce Sandbox</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Salesforce Sandbox</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Salesforce Sandbox Admin User Name textbox, type a Salesforce sandbox account name that has the System Administrator profile in Salesforce.com assigned.
trans-unit.target: In the Salesforce Sandbox Admin User Name textbox, type a Salesforce sandbox account name that has the System Administrator profile in Salesforce.com assigned.

trans-unit.source: In the Salesforce Sandbox Admin Password textbox, type the password for this account.
trans-unit.target: In the Salesforce Sandbox Admin Password textbox, type the password for this account.

trans-unit.source: In the User Security Token textbox, paste the security token value.
trans-unit.target: In the User Security Token textbox, paste the security token value.

trans-unit.source: Click Validate to verify your configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Validate to verify your configuration.

trans-unit.source: Click the Next button to open the Confirmation page.
trans-unit.target: Click the Next button to open the Confirmation page.

trans-unit.source: On the Confirmation page, click Complete to save your configuration.
trans-unit.target: On the Confirmation page, click Complete to save your configuration.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Salesforce Sandbox, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Salesforce Sandbox, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Salesforce Sandbox **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Salesforce Sandbox **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You should now wait for 10 minutes and verify that the account has been synchronized to Salesforce Sandbox.
trans-unit.target: You should now wait for 10 minutes and verify that the account has been synchronized to Salesforce Sandbox.

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
